New Records: Shohei Ohtani reached 400 total bases, becoming the first player to do so since 2001.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers scored five runs in the seventh inning to win the game 7-2.
Will Smith hit a tying, two-run homer in the seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers had not clinched at home since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani was showered with champagne and said, 'It stung a little bit in my eyes. It was an awesome feeling and Iâ€™m hoping to be able to continue popping more champagne.'
The Dodgers improved to 95-64 and will open the playoffs on Oct. 5 at home in a best-of-five Division Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A sellout crowd of 52,433, including retired Dodgers star Manny Ramirez, packed Dodger Stadium for the finale of the crucial series.
Others: The Dodgers took two of three from the Padres and head to Colorado for a three-game set to conclude the regular season.
Freddie Freeman was on crutches and in a walking boot after the game due to an injured right ankle.
